page.title: 17OLD PEOPLE
page.content: Help the Aged survives through peoples personal contributions.Old people are lonely so the Social Services run day centres.In the day centres they can do keep-fit,computers and there are hair-dressers,they have hot meals and have a mini-bus to collect them and bring them back.ST.JohnÂ£s is a sheltered unit for elderly in need.The warden is called Mrs Olive. There are dinner ladies who cook the dinners. The day we came we had Roast pork,roast potatoes brussel sprouts,for pudding we had Ice Cream and chocolate sauce.Voluntary services take lunches to some homes which cost 65p. The day at St Johns was very interesting and we enjoyed it all very much. BY Samantha Brown and Andrew Hayward.
